intro: Bryonia multifida, commonly known as the forked bryony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, melons, and squashes. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a spiny, orange-yellow berry that ripens in late summer.
